intro: Thyrocarpus sampsonii, commonly known as the Socotra starfish tree, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the family Burseraceae and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, making it a rare and valuable species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered vulnerable to extinction.
